page.title: 05THE ROYAL AIR FORCE
page.content: During the second world war,about two hundred airmen were based in Scorton.Some of them lived in huts in a field near the hospital.This is where Clarence Road is now.Others lived at Bolton-on Swale,and some on the site next to school.The R.A.F.had its own water supply.It was a bore hole,behind where the police station now stands. At the Forest there were false runway lights.They were to distract the German pilots from bombing the real aerodrome at Scorton. Around Scorton and at the Forest there were powerful searchlights to spot enemy aircraft approaching to bomb Catterick Garrison. As well as British airmen,a few Americans were also based here.
